author: pcgeek86
body: How would one configure iTerm2 in order to go forward / back a word in PowerShell Core? Right now, if I try to use `ALT + B` and `ALT + F` keyboard shortcuts, the result is simply that a `b` or `f` character is printed. I even tried manually adding keyboard mappings to the PowerShell iTerm2 profile, but this didn't seem to have any effect positive or negative. Both Bash and ZSH use the `ALT + B` and `ALT + F` keyboard shortcuts to go forward and back a word. Cheers, **Trevor Sullivan** Docker Captain Microsoft MVP: Cloud & Data Center Management https://trevorsullivan.net https://twitter.com/pcgeek86
